page.title: 14WEST HULL ELECTIONS
page.content: The area is divided into 4 wards for the local elections. These wards have an average electorate of 9,054. In the Humberside County Council election of May 1985 the Labour Party won 3 wards, the Conservative Party won 1. The total number of votes in 4 wards were Labour 6,057, Conservative 2,655. Liberal/SDP 1,799. The Poll was a very low average of 29% in the General election of June 1983. The area is part of the West Hull Constituency. The Labour Party won this election with a majority of 3,654. Over the Conservatives who were 2nd.The Liberal Alliance were 3rd with 9,575, the Poll was 63%. The share of votes in 1983 election showed the emergence of the Liberal/SDP Alliance who took votes from the Labour Party. The majority was reduced this reflected the national trend in the 1983 election.
